page.title: 08OWNERS OF HALL- HOUGHTON
page.content: HOUGHTON HALL was built for ROBERT WALPOLE made a KNIGHT of the BATH in 1725 and KNIGHT of the GARTER in 1726.On leaving the house of commons in 1742 he became the first EARL of ORFORD.His son ,ROBERT, succeeded him in 1745,and GEORGE, third EARL of ORFORD, was in possession from 1751 to 1791.It then passed to HORACE, youngest son of ROBERT, first EARL of ORFORD.HORACE did not, at that stage, come to HOUGHTON, but sent agents to tidy up after the depredations of his nephew GEORGE..The title,EARL of ORFORD, of this creation died with HORACE WALPOLE but the estate passed through MARY,sister to HORACE,to GEORGE,4th. EARL of CHOLMONDELEY, created MARQUESS in 1815.Possession still remains with the CHOLMONDELEY family.
